statements: SELECT * FROM employee_work_schedule LIMIT 5;
SELECT employee_id, work_schedule FROM employee_work_schedule WHERE remote_meetings = TRUE;
SELECT * FROM employee_work_schedule WHERE availability ->> 'monday' = 'available';
SELECT * FROM employee_work_schedule ORDER BY employee_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM employee_work_schedule WHERE employee_id = 'db99c9f0-08c5-4714-aa12-1f77c68faf01';
SELECT * FROM employee_work_schedule WHERE remote_meetings = TRUE;
SELECT employee_id, work_schedule->'start_time' AS start_time, work_schedule->'end_time' AS end_time FROM employee_work_schedule;
SELECT * FROM employee_work_schedule WHERE availability->>'status' = 'available';
SELECT * FROM employee_work_schedule ORDER BY employee_id DESC;
SELECT employee_id, work_schedule, remote_meetings FROM employee_work_schedule WHERE availability->>'status' != 'busy';
SELECT * FROM employee_work_schedules;
SELECT employee_id, work_schedule FROM employee_work_schedules WHERE availability_for_meetings = true;
SELECT * FROM remote_meeting_availability ORDER BY employee_id DESC, meeting_date ASC;
SELECT employee_id, COUNT(*) AS total_meetings FROM remote_meeting_availability GROUP BY employee_id;
SELECT employee_id, meeting_date FROM remote_meeting_availability WHERE availability_status = true;
SELECT employee_id, work_schedule FROM employee_work_schedules WHERE availability_for_meetings = TRUE;
SELECT * FROM employee_work_schedules WHERE employee_id = 123;
SELECT employee_id, work_schedule FROM employee_work_schedules WHERE work_schedule LIKE 'M%' ORDER BY employee_id DESC;
SELECT employee_id, COUNT(*) as meeting_count FROM remote_meeting_availability GROUP BY employee_id HAVING meeting_count > 5;
SELECT employee_id, meeting_date FROM remote_meeting_availability WHERE availability_status = TRUE ORDER BY meeting_date ASC;
SELECT * FROM employee_schedule;
SELECT employee_id, schedule_date, start_time FROM employee_schedule;
SELECT end_time, schedule_date, availability FROM employee_schedule WHERE employee_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM meeting_availability WHERE available = TRUE;
SELECT meeting_id, schedule_date FROM meeting_schedule ORDER BY schedule_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM employee_schedule;
SELECT employee_id, schedule_date FROM employee_schedule WHERE availability = TRUE;
SELECT meeting_id, schedule_date, start_time FROM meeting_schedule ORDER BY schedule_date DESC;
SELECT meeting_id, start_time, end_time FROM meeting_schedule WHERE organizer_id = 2;
SELECT employee_id, schedule_date, start_time, end_time FROM employee_schedule JOIN meeting_schedule ON employee_id = organizer_id;
SELECT * FROM employee;
SELECT employee_name, work_schedule FROM employee ORDER BY work_schedule DESC;
SELECT * FROM meeting WHERE meeting_location='Conference Room A';
SELECT meeting_name FROM meeting WHERE meeting_datetime > '2022-09-01';
SELECT employee_id, date, work_hours FROM schedule WHERE work_hours >= 8 ORDER BY date ASC;
SELECT * FROM employee WHERE availability = TRUE;
SELECT employee_name, work_schedule FROM employee WHERE employee_id = 1;
SELECT meeting_id, meeting_name, meeting_datetime FROM meeting WHERE meeting_location = 'Conference Room';
SELECT e.employee_name, s.date, s.work_hours FROM employee e JOIN schedule s ON e.employee_id = s.employee_id;
SELECT m.meeting_name, e.employee_name, ma.is_attending FROM meeting m JOIN meeting_attendance ma ON m.meeting_id = ma.meeting_id JOIN employee e ON ma.employee_id = e.employee_id;
SELECT * FROM meeting_schedule;
SELECT meeting_id, meeting_date, topic FROM meeting_schedule WHERE remote_meeting = TRUE;
SELECT employee_id, schedule_date, start_time, end_time FROM employee_schedule WHERE availability = TRUE;
SELECT meeting_id, start_time, end_time FROM meeting_schedule ORDER BY meeting_date DESC;
SELECT employee_id, availability_date, available FROM employee_availability WHERE available = TRUE;
SELECT * FROM meeting_schedule ORDER BY meeting_date DESC, start_time ASC LIMIT 10
SELECT topic, meeting_date FROM meeting_schedule WHERE remote_meeting = TRUE
SELECT meeting_id, COUNT(employee_id) AS total_attendees FROM meeting_attendance GROUP BY meeting_id HAVING total_attendees > 5
SELECT employee_id, availability_date FROM employee_availability WHERE available = TRUE ORDER BY availability_date
SELECT employee_id, MAX(availability_date) AS latest_availability FROM employee_availability GROUP BY employee_id
